body: https://i.imgur.com/LMFNqiI.png

It looks like we don't have data for the volunteer page, so maybe this should just be a simple like Volunteer request form? Maybe with some information (data) about what volunteering may involve.  I think we will have to create content for this page...
This should also include the views for creating users, validation, and error handling.
We should also look into hashing & salting the Passwords
Perhaps we can talk to @ashleygwilliams about what sort of information belongs on this page.
I think that should be it's own issue
Done!
Looks great!
travis-ci seems to be setup, added a build status to the readme as well @nrhubbar. We can look at opening a PR to merge my changes from the travis-ci branch whenever you're ready.
Fix! https://github.com/rustbridge/rustbridge.io/pull/19

it might be helpful to refer to this! i don't think it's as detailed as i'd want so perhaps after reading it you can make a PR to enhance it a bit: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-project-layout
I have made the requested changes.
Working on this now.
Waiting on project structure changes before I continue on this

Hey one last comment, should we include the flexibility to break this project into 2 smaller projects, client side and server side? 

Or do you think this is **Too Much** future proofing and will make things overly complicated?

This feature won't come into fruition for awhile. @technetos

There was talk of using wasm for the front end; however, for now I think that the best course of action is to get the current implementation of the website refactored and fleshed out so that the remaining issues can be tackled with ease.
Sounds good, :shipit: 🚢 it
I have accounted for the requested changes.

Adding users has been handled and documented, see [rustbridge-cli][1]

[1]: https://github.com/rustbridge/rustbridge-cli
@rupsis can you clarify what this issue is?
I have made the requested changes

Yeah, this is really 2 issues. We need to design the database schema for workshops, and create/implement the back end logic to actually create the workshop. During the hackathon, we had created a very basic workshop submission form, but hadn't implemented it yet.
